title: Coding Subagents - The Next Evolution of AI IDEs
description:
Everyone is using an AI IDE for coding like Windsurf or Cursor now. They make you ultra productive and have started to incorporate incredible new features to understand the documentation of our favorite frameworks and integrate with protocols like Claude’s Model Context Protocol (MCP). The problem is, these AI IDEs have just as many flaws as they have strengths. They hallucinate code ALL the time, even when given extensive documentation and instructions.

It’s time for these AI coding assistants to get a BIG upgrade to tackle these problems, and I think I’ve started to uncover what the next wave of evolution is for this. It all revolves around specialized “subagents” and Claude’s MCP. Just hear me out on this in the video, I think it’s going to be huge and I explain why. I even demonstrate how to take Archon, the AI agent I started recently that creates other AI agents with Pydantic AI and LangGraph, and turn it into an MCP subagent for Windsurf and Cursor! So you get a real example of this concept that I think is going to blow up this year.
